title: D-Link DIR-1935 HNAP PrivateLogin Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of D-Link DIR-1935 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of HNAP login requests. The issue results from the lack of proper implementation of the authentication algorithm. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to bypass authentication on the system.
addtionnal_details: D-Link has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://supportannouncement.us.dlink.com/announcement/publication.aspx?name=SAP10310
timeline:
2022-06-17 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2022-11-03 - Coordinated public release of advisory
